meanings.definition: To grant or give something as a favor or privilege.
meanings.sent1: The kind teacher vouchsafed extra time for the struggling student.
meanings.sent2: She vouchsafed her approval for the project to proceed.
meanings.sent3: The cat vouchsafed a purr of contentment after being petted.
meanings.sent4: The sun vouchsafed its warm rays to the flowers, helping them bloom.
meanings.sent5: The king vouchsafed a pardon to the prisoner, showing mercy.

meanings.definition: To condescend to grant or bestow something.
meanings.sent1: He vouchsafed a smile to the young child who approached him.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman vouchsafed a donation to the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The cat vouchsafed a playful swat at the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The clouds vouchsafed a brief glimpse of the blue sky above.
meanings.sent5: The queen vouchsafed a nod of approval to her loyal subject.

meanings.definition: To deign to give or grant something.
meanings.sent1: The celebrity vouchsafed an autograph to the excited fan.
meanings.sent2: The professor vouchsafed an extension on the assignment deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat vouchsafed a regal meow before settling down for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The river vouchsafed its cool waters to the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The judge vouchsafed a fair trial to all who appeared in court.
